releases/0/tender/description:
The National Composites Centre (NCC) is an independent, open-access national centre that delivers world-class innovation in the design and rapid manufacture of composites and facilitates their widespread industrial exploitation. 
Out-of-autoclave (OoA) manufacturing has established itself as a way to process next-generation composite structures, and is seen to be a crucial area for development. In this context, the NCC has identified a need to procure a suite of equipment, to provide a Large Scale Capability to directly support key Aerospace and other sectors such as Automotive, Marine and Oil and Gas research and development programs. This procurement is for a composite curing oven capable of producing aero structures up to 20 metres in length to directly support key manufacturing research and development programs.
The capability shall be specified, procured and commissioned to ensure suitability for industrial research and development programs as well as supporting maturation of emerging manufacturing technologies from academia toward industrial application. 

The NCC is seeking to procure a turnkey solution for a Large Scale Oven capable of curing and supporting the infusion of composite components of up to circa 20m x 5m x 2.5m. Temperature range from 40°C to 250°C, with integrated vacuum system and a comprehensive data acquisition capability.

Full Specifications and details are within the tender pack located on the University of Bristol Tender Portal.
releases/0/tender/classification/descrip: Industrial or laboratory furnaces, incinerators and ovens

releases/0/tender/title: On Line Booking System for Driver Training Courses
releases/0/tender/description:
The On Line Booking system should allow clients to book online or by telephone and   process the required fee. Online bookings should allow clients to choose their preferred venue and course date within 'expiry' dates (by interrogating the police database) and pay for the course at the same time.  All information passed over the internet will require high level of security and the system must have full PCI DSS compliance.
The system should operate in 'real time' and continually monitor all processes with regard to the operation of the scheme administration.

releases/0/tender/description:
A single company is to be selected to provide maintenance services for the following Lots, which will be organised by the Estate and Facilities Management Department of Merseyside Police -
- Building works
- Mechanical works
- Electrical works.
(Note  the Locksmith Lot is separate to this Framework)
The service required is for all of the above lots and expressions for particular lots only, will be disregarded.
Work streams are as follows- Reactive repairs to respond to faults / breakdowns, which will include an out of-
hours helpdesk and service response, particularly for matters critical to Police operations and safety.
Pro-active servicing of elements / plant and equipment on a regular basis to
ensure safe and efficient usage and to reduce future incidences of reactive
repairs.
Merseyside Police are currently progressing an Estate Strategy programme rationalising its properties to better suit modern policing requirements. The service required of this framework will include new and refurbished buildings and long-standing existing buildings.
releases/0/tender/additionalClassificati: Repair and maintenance services of building installations
Repair and maintenance services of electrical and mechanical building installations
Repair and maintenance services of electrical building installations
Repair and maintenance services of mechanical building installations

Text to be corrected in the original notice:
        Place of text to be modified: IV.2.2 Time limit for receipt of tenders or requests to participate / Time limit for receipt of expressions of interest
        Instead of: 
        Read: 
        Swindon Borough Council is seeking to appoint a service provider for each of the two zones Swindon North - Lot 1 and Swindon South - Lot 2 who will coordinate, manage and deliver (both directly and indirectly) domiciliary care and community support services. The successful providers will be required to transition the provision of the services to service users from a traditional time/task service model to an outcomes-based service model with the aspiration of providing the services on the basis of an agreed Capitated Budget. The Council will also consider a sole Provider (Lot 3) to provide services for the whole of Swindon, however, the Provider will need to demonstrate they are exceptional.  The term of the Contract will be 10 years subject to contract reviews at years 3, 5 and 8 where the Parties will have the option to make changes to the Contract or terminate the arrangements. See the tender documents at https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk  DN285241

releases/0/tender/title: Children's Residential Block Bed Placements - 13 to 17 years of Age
releases/0/tender/description:
The Council is looking to contract with providers by way of Competitive Dialogue to secure block beds placements (including emergency bed arrangements) for children aged 13 -17 years of age, detailed in the Tender Documents. We will seek to enter into a contract with a provider(s) for a period of up to four years, with the option to extend for a further two years, plus a further two years after this if required. As part of the contract any vacant beds will be able to be offered to other local authorities should they not be required to mitigate any risks.
      
      The tender opportunity will be run electronically through the London Tenders Portal and providers will need to register their company with the portal as soon as possible (if they have not already done so) at www.londontenders.org to ensure they are able to access and submit the relevant documents online. All applications MUST be made through the London Tenders Portal ONLY and NOT to the Contact Details contained within this notice.
releases/0/tender/documents/1/descriptio: Please follow this link to view the notice.

releases/0/tender/title: Provision of the Green Deal Oversight and Registration Body
releases/0/tender/description: BEIS is looking for a contractor to administer the Green Deal (GD) Oversight and Registration Body (GD ORB) from 1 July 2017. The GD was launched in January 2013 as a framework under which consumers could take out 'pay as you save' loans for energy efficiency and microgeneration measures installed on their property. The GD ORB acts as the Secretary of State' delivery arm to administer the functions of the GD. It acts as the lynchpin between the electricity suppliers collection of GD payments, the operation of the GD on the ground and the display of GD information to consumers via an Energy Performance Certificate.

releases/0/tender/title: Provision of the Green Deal Ombudsman and Investigation Services
releases/0/tender/description:
The Department for Business Energy & Industrial Strategy (BEIS) is looking for a contractor to administer the Green Deal (GD) Ombudsman and Investigation Service (OIS) from 14 June 2017. 
      The GD was launched in January 2013 as a framework under which consumers could take out 'pay as you save' loans for energy efficiency and microgeneration measures installed on their property. These loans are repaid over the lifetime of the measure through the electricity bill. Responsibility for the loan repayments passes to future occupiers of the property. 
      The OIS ensures an independent customer redress process is available when something goes wrong with a GD Plan and is an essential element of the customer redress landscape for the GD market.
